content.title: One Time Cash Incentive towards acquiring BEd, BPEd, DTEd, PGDCA (Sainik Welfare)
content.details: One Time Cash Incentive towards acquiring BEd, BPEd, DTEd, PGDCA is a Welfare Scheme by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. Through this scheme, up to ₹20,000/- is provided to the unemployed Ex-servicemen to pursue the mentioned programs/courses from Government-recognized Schools/Institutions, upon prior permission from the Department. The application should be submitted offline within three months from the date of successful completion of the course.
benefits: The actual cost of the program/course or ₹20,000/- is provided to the ESM.
The amount, as decided by the Management Committee, is credited to the beneficiary’s Bank Account through RTGS/ NEFT.
eligibility: The applicant should be an Ex-serviceman.
The applicant should be registered with the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry.
The applicant should have obtained prior permission from the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry.
The applicant should apply within three years of discharge from service.
The course/program should be done from a Government-recognized School/Institution.

The course/program should be one of the following: Bachelor of Education (BEd), Bachelor of Physical Education (BPEd), Diploma in Teacher Education (DTEd), Post Graduate Diploma in Computer Applications (PGDCA).
exclusions: The scope of this scheme will not apply to those ESM / living spouse/widows who are re-employed as regular / deemed to be regular in Government/Public Sector Undertakings/Private Organizations and self-employed IT assesses.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should visit the Rajya Sainik Board, Jawan Bhawan, Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Puducherry, and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned authority. The application should be submitted within three months from the date of successful completion of the course.
documents_required: Proof of Successful Completion of the Course (Marksheet, Degree, etc).

faqs.question: Which Department of the UT of Puducherry administers this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is administered by the Department of Sainik Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry.

faqs.question: Where can I find the URL of the Official Website of the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry?
faqs.answer: The URL of the Official Website of the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry is: https://sainik.py.gov.in/

faqs.question: Are Short Service/Emergency commissioned Officers eligible for the status of ex-servicemen?
faqs.answer: Yes, if released on completion of the specific period of engagement and were given gratuity at the time of release.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for seeking information through 'Right To Information (RTI)'?
faqs.answer: The required information may be asked through an application along with IPO/DD for a sum of ₹10/- in favour of the Director, Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry.

faqs.question: What is the definition of 'Ex-Servicemen' for the purpose of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The definition of 'Ex-Servicemen' can be accessed through the following URL: https://sainik.py.gov.in/definition-ex-servicemen

faqs.question: Where can I find detailed guidelines for the welfare schemes provided by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Department of Sainik Welfare?
faqs.answer: For detailed guidelines, you can refer to the official document available at the following URL: https://sainik.py.gov.in/assistance-affd-fund

faqs.question: Where can I get the application forms for the welfare schemes provided by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Department of Sainik Welfare?
faqs.answer: The application forms can be accessed through the following URL: https://sainik.py.gov.in/application-forms

faqs.question: Where should the application form be submitted for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted on a working day, and during working hours to the competent authority at the Rajya Sainik Board, Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Puducherry.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The guidelines do not mention any provision for compensation in the event of delayed disbursement of scheme benefits.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory to Have a Bank Account for This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, possession of a valid bank account is a mandatory requirement for participation in this scheme.
